text: Lisa Ray (born 4 April 1972) is an Indian-Canadian actress. She began her modelling career in the early 1990s. She appeared for leading brands, such as Lamk√© and Bombay Dyeing. She began acting in 1996 with the Tamil language action movie Nethaji. Her first Bollywood appearance was the 2001 romantic- thriller movie Kasoor. In 2009 Ray was diagnosed with the blood cancer multiple myeloma. She began writing The Yellow Diaries, a blog about her experiences with cancer. She is an active advocate for stem cell therapy. Ray has participated in several fundraisers and cancer awareness campaigns. In 2011 Ray began hosting a popular travel show on Discovery Channel India. She also appeared as judge and host in Food Network's Top Chef Canada. In March 2019 Ray participated as a panelist on the 2019 edition of Canada Reads. She worked for David Chariandy's award-winning second novel Brother.
